distribution.text: Copyright 2024 SUSE LLC. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
This update for systemd fixes the following issues:
  
- CVE-2022-4415: Fixed systemd-coredump that did not respect the fs.suid_dumpable kernel setting (bsc#1205000).

Bug fixes:

- Restrict cpu rule to x86_64, and also update the rule files to make use of the 'CONST{arch}' syntax (bsc#1204423).
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: CSAF 2.0 data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
notes.title: Terms of use

relationships.relates_to_product_reference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12 SP5

notes.text: A vulnerability was found in systemd. This security flaw can cause a local information leak due to systemd-coredump not respecting the fs.suid_dumpable kernel setting.
notes.title: CVE description

remediations.details: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".
